Introduction: ^. You've been appointed captain of a scientific journey into the depths of the Earth; your mission, to find and study a Wyrm. Wyrms are dreadful beasts that thrive in the deep dark soil under the earth; you and your crew are prepared to do whatever it takes. Your reward;

s0: ^the endless gratitude of the philosopher-kings of Athens.
s5: ^a mausoleum in the Field of the Wyrmchasers

Introduction: ^. The deeper you dig, the more difficult things will get; but the closer you'll come to finding the wyrm.
Mutiny: ^Your crew are tired of being cooped up in this metal coffin. "

s5: ^We want to see my family again!
s10: ^I don't even like wyrms that much!

Mutiny: ^" they shout. A mutiny is brewing.

Diplomacy: ^Diplomacy never hurt anyone; but it takes time, time, precious time, while all the while the heat of the earth seeps into your wyrmdigger.

c: ^If we turn back now, what was the point of all this? Some of your crew mumble in agreement; but that argument isn't likely to work twice.
^The vote runs close; in the end, your vote breaks the tie.

Diplomacy: ^Struggle, one last time, to persuade them.

c: ^They warn you; they won't listen again.
^ No matter how hard you try, it's impossible to put forward a reasonable argument. You are swiftly deposed, and your crew start the long journey back to the surface.

Rebellion: ^Brutal, short and to the point; violence is the answer to many questions.

c: ^You execute a crewman right there and then! Their loyalty is reinvigorated, for now...

s: ^If it's war they want... Then it's a war they'll get. You gather the loyal crew and fight a bitter battle to the end.

c: ^Holing up in the captain's office, you fight and fight and fight. In the end, you're left terribly wounded; you'll never survive another battle like this.
^ It's no good; your crew's loyalty is frayed, and you won't last a second in a fight. Give up, return to the surface.

s1: ^It's considered lucky to have two birthdays in one voyage.
s8: ^The crew are definitely trying to pull something here.

s0: ^they've used your supplies to bake and eat a really big cake
s2: ^someone has drunkenly punched a hole in a wall

c: ^ and all their friends are very sad.

Drill_1: ^Your drill churns ever onward, through miles of dirt and stone. You have a quiet evening to yourself.

s0: ^You stretch, yawn, and lean back in your chair.
s1: ^You flip through a book on philosophy
s2: ^You read the hot new epic that's all the rage lately
s5: ^It's nice to take some time off every now and then.
s6: ^You enjoy exactly one jug of wine.
s7: ^You chat briefly with some of your crew, but they don't have anything interesting to say.
s8: ^You fiddle about with the latest steam-curiosity.
s9: ^A fun time was had by all.
s11: ^You read an exciting poem about a wyrmchaser. It's hardly accurate, but it is thrilling.

c: ^They tell you that they could increase the speed, but it'll ding the hull.

s7: ^Looking out the window is always wildly exciting.

Drill_2: ^Your drill is a great corkscrew sheathed in steel, spiraling ever downwards. Every now and then, it digs up trouble; but not today.
Drill_3: ^On the surface, they think the only thing to be found this deep is horror and death. Not so; occasionally, you find boredom.
Drill_4: ^The efforts of Athens' finest minds have gotten you this far, but even they must find themselves at a loose end sometimes.

s2: ^far too early for this sort of thing

s0: ^I can't sleep, see, with all the noise, so I've been thinking...
s1: ^Cap, us and the boys have been talking

b: ^Reckon the hull can't take much more of this heat. We need to find a way to cool it, and fast.
^What are we going to do when we find this wyrm?

c: ^"All shall be well, and maybe all manner of thing too!"
^Must you do everything on this damn digger!? You're the captain here, and you're doing fine; that's what matters.

s1: ^All nods and humble mutterings, but the
^ isn't one to forget this kind of thing.

s0: ^There's an Officer for this kind of thing; usually is, anyway.
s1: ^The worry stays etched on their face as they rush back out.

Dozing_off: ^The constant whir of the drill feels almost restful. Nobody will mind if you just lie here for a moment...

c: ^Just close your eyes for a bit, it'll be fine.

s2: ^ You pass through the soil like a fish in water.
s3: ^ The tracks you leave behind are a testament to your majesty.

s1: ^ A twisting maze of many tunnels, all unalike.

s2: ^ Spiraling inwards, towards a definite point, eternally.
s3: ^ The wide becomes thin, becomes wide again.
s4: ^ Pierce the vault of the earth.
s5: ^Your body is a stair; your head, a spear.

c: ^You sit upright; can't sleep, you have work to do!

Ration_trouble: ^Your crew are concerned that they're going to starve before they ever catch sight of a wyrm.

c: ^! They'll be happy, but soon they'll be hungry.
^Can't do much about it this far underground.

tracks: ^Your scouts have reported something at the fringes of the drill-lights; something like a wyrmtrack. Not the track you're following... probably.

c: ^Maybe it'll be something interesting; maybe you'd been drifting off course the whole time.
^You remain resolutely stuck to your current path.

s4: ^The rasp of metal. Not the hull?

weird_creaking: ^. The crews eyes swivel as they finger weapons.
tremor: ^ Whatever the case, your wyrmdigger isn't in good shape.
lost_trail: ^You've lost sight of the wyrmtrack somewhere in all the dirt and darkness.

c: ^If you keep going down, you'll find it eventually.

gasdanger: ^Chief Aeoliphile warns you that you're running straight into a pocket of gas.

s0: ^You emerge unscathed on the other side
s1: ^Everything explodes! You survive but only just about.
^Fans just move the stifling air around in circles

s0: ^A day's diversion finds an underground river; You refill the onboard Baths, but the wyrm has pressed on without you...
s1: ^A day of pointless drilling; You find nothing. The heat feels so much worse for that wasted effort

s0: ^The crew strip down to undergarments, and you join them. Hellenic spirit prevails!

s1: ^The crew clench their teeth and crack on, working tirelessly. The heat lingers.

Diamonds: ^'s eyes shine just as bright in the lamplight.

c: ^A bonus even your crew can't complain at! Except for the Stoker, whose engines now groan under the extra weight...
^Mutinous stares and grim faces, but you know the real prize awaits in the depths.

Wyrmcast: ^The wyrm has passed through here, shedding its skin as it passed. A slimy, sinuous cast of wyrmflesh lies in the way of your drill.
^Use the beak-shards to sharpen the drill

c: ^The wyrm once used this beak to cut through the earth; now you'll do it in its stead.

Wyrmcast: ^Use the moult to harden the hull

c: ^Its segmented flesh is harder than boiled leather, perfectly adapted to the stresses of the deep earth.
^They pay well for this meat in Athens; your crew should consider themselves fortunate.

Shroom: ^Use the stems to patch up your hull

c: ^Not the most solid material on or under the earth, but it'll hold things together for a while
^Mushroom-flesh is woody and unappetising, but it provides enough sustenance for now.

Encampment: ^Some explorers have set up shop here; they have tools and supplies you could use.

c: ^ for food. They only have old cans and some unappetising mushrooms, but it'll keep you going.
^They shower you with gifts! Most of them aren't terribly useful, but you manage to gather some supplies and material for the hull. Getting rid of the diamonds lightened your load, too.

WyrmGlimpse: ^Shouting from the observation deck! There've been sightings of something pale and undulating, just beyond the drill's tip. Could it be the

c: ^This is it! This is what you've been looking for! You whip the stokers up into a frenzy, and the wyrmdigger lurches forward, scraping along the tunnel walls.
^You've come this far; no need to throw it all away at the final hurdle. Slowly, steadily, your drill weaves its way into the wyrm's tunnel.

Glimpse2: ^Your drill cracks through the levee of the wyrm's tunnel. Piercing the layer of the wyrm's tunnel takes time; slowly, slowly, slowly but surely, you ease your way into the great beast's tunnel.

c: ^You have your notepad ready. Steel yourself.

Toolate: ^The drill pierces the thick levee of soil the wyrm disturbed. But too slow, too little, too late! You arrive only in time to see the wyrm insinuating itself further and further into the earth. But you have it now; wyrms find the vibrations of the drill impossibly enticing. It'll dance around you like a moth around a flame; and when it comes, you'll be ready.

WyrmRunin: ^The wyrm has pierced your tunnel; this is the best chance you're going to have to get up close and personal.
^But what will you do with the wyrm when you reach it?
^Complete your mission: Study the wyrm for science

c: ^You've been given a task, and you intend to complete it; even if it seems mundane.
^Killing a wyrm has a glory of its very own. Turn your wyrmdigger to face the beast head-on.

WyrmChaseScience: ^Hand your notebook to a scribe; it'll be easier if you can dedicate all your focus to

c: ^Head-on accounts of wyrms like this are rare. You manage to bark out half a description of
^, but it sweeps upon you with terrible speed!
^This is the best view of a wyrm you're ever going to get!
^The wyrm is right there! It's time to flee, before there's nothing left of you.

WyrmChaseMurder: ^Charge! Your drill takes time to align, but the wyrm's still some distance away. You ready a battlecry: "
^". It's not very good, but you're only a scientist.
^The wyrm's great maw descends upon you, and everything turns black.
^Face a Wyrm in single combat? You? You're a scientist, not a warrior!
ScienceEnding: ^The inside of a Wyrm! Nobody has ever been inside a wyrm and survived before!

^This is, as it turns out, for good reason. Your drill is crushed and crumpled to nothing by the wyrm's great digestion. On the bright side, if anyone ever manages to find your mangled wyrmdigger, they'll find the most comprehensive account of a wyrm's bowels on or under the earth.
MurderEnding: ^Cackling maniacally, your driller rockets towards the

^, powered by Alexandria's finest engines. Few wyrmchasers have ever fought a wyrm and survived; for good reason, as it turns out. The inside of a wyrm is terribly hostile towards anything that isn't a wyrm, and your wyrmdriller certainly wasn't built for it. A swarm of tiny parasitic
^'s lunge for your driller, burrowing into every crack and crevice of your ship. You hear
^ scream; then you, too, are beset by wyrms.

^Somehow, your foolish endeavour actually ended well. Your driller managed to stumble forward and pierce the wyrm's tiny brain, ending its life instantly. Some day, someone may find the husk of the wyrm; and your drill, crewed by skeletons.
LoserEnding: ^Your nerve doesn't hold; you flee from the wyrm before it falls upon you with all its slithering might.

^The surface is far, far, far away, and your crew is scattered or dazed or half-dead. Eventually, your drill shudders to a halt; the sane and stable among you, few though you are, manage to crawl through a tunnel into a fungal cavern. You live out the rest of your days there, and never see the sun again. It's not a good life, and you wonder what you might have gained, if you had managed to steel yourself just a moment longer.
HullEnding: ^Your drill comes apart! Your hull falls to pieces! Your engine, tired with mistreatment, explodes! The long and short of it is that you are dead.
